name: The Nines, Portland

reviews.text: Not a luxury hotel. When you have to plug your phones into the outlet in the bathroom, your bed doesn't have a night stand, and there are no robes in the room - you have to wonder who designed the hotel. In terms of the decor- it is art-deco at its finest, sadly the person who designed the rooms didn't think that the modern traveling family would need outlets for ipads, iphones, and the Kindles.
reviews.title: Not a luxury hotel - its ok, value is poor

reviews.text: This hotel is suppose to be in the "luxury" line of hotels - from Starwood, and yet they forget that luxury involves the little things: when you request a crib, and you have the room reserved, it should be waiting for you - in this case it wasn't. But that also meant that no one thought to child proof the room. Were there blankets for the crib? No.
reviews.title: One of my favorites in Portland...

reviews.text: Robes in the room - not there- but in later communication with the hotel, they told us that they were simply not placed in the room (how does a luxury hotel with housekeeping not check that?).
reviews.title: Excellent, excellent place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great location - great restaurants in the hotel. Young crowd, so it can be loud.
reviews.title: Great Decor w/ Rowdy Clientele and Rude Staff

reviews.text: Parking in this downtown is always an issue- and valet parking is another $40 a day. If you want the concierge floor it is an extra $50 a day (they like upcharges).
reviews.title: Superb!

reviews.text: We had a chance to stay at this hotel where the service was exceptional and the accommodations were just as outstanding. The hotel bar scene is very lively. The main restaurant is very meat oriented so if you want anything but meat dishes try the great dining around town. The hotel is right along the modern trolley line so getting around is easy. Just watch out that downtown Portland has three lanes in each direction, but only one for cars. So you may have to go around three or four blocks to be able to make a left turn and negotiate the one way streets. Once you get a hang of this, it makes a lot of sense. The concierge desk is incredibably helpful and should get six stars.
reviews.title: What a great hotel
Wedding trip
reviews.text: I found the hotel accommodations/amenities/staff to be top notch.
Mark M. was especially helpful in navigating the area for a non-city person!
reviews.title: Very nice, but five star is overstating it.

reviews.text: I don't know exactly how the whole four star hotel vs five star hotel designation works, but I think it is misapplied to The Nines and may set you up for a slight disappointment. That being said, the hotel is beautiful it has nice rooms and a great location. Very nice place to stay when you are in Portland, just don't overpay to stay here.
reviews.title: Concierge, Lounge and Guest Rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My fourth stay here. Concierge lounge on the 12th floor is one of the nicest SPG lounges I've been in. Great place to read during the afternoon, or enjoy a glass of local wine/beer before dinner. Super friendly/helpful staff. As for rooms:  my room  on the 5th avenue side is bigger than previous rooms I've stayed in  along Morrison, Alder, or 6th.
reviews.title: Beautiful hotel, just avoid Urban Farmer.

reviews.text: Nice Hotel... Good Location but ask for your window not to face the inside... because the inside is where the restaurant is and lobby... so the noise can be loud at night
reviews.title: Nice Hotel... Good Location but ask for your window not to face the inside
Great place for the "it" place to stay.
reviews.text: -Nice decor
-Nice Staff
reviews.title: Family Time

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: -GREAT Club Lounge that serves drinks and light food most of the day... cocktails and beer included
reviews.title: Classic Elegance in a Modern Setting

reviews.text: -GREAT Valet Staff
reviews.title: It's A Good Hotel

reviews.text: Stayed two nights during a business trip. Great location in the heart of downtown Portland. You enter the main lobby on street level but take the elevator to 8 to check-in. Large rooms with chic lighting and sofas. The hint of Tiffany Blue is seen throughout the hotel from the room keycard to wall textures. Fabulous Starwood property! Try the onsite restaurant- Urban Farmer for lunch or dinner. Have a drink at the rooftop bar - Departures and watch the city come alive!
reviews.title: Fabulous Hotel

reviews.text: We were here for a family member's college graduation. My parents have stayed here many times, and were glad to be returning. However, this stay was disappointing for all of us. My family always requests corner rooms that come with a fantastic view. When we checked in and asked if we had corner rooms, the woman simply said no. My parents asked for an upgrade, which they were happy to pay for, the woman disregarded their request without an explanation. She could have at least said there were none available. The rooms were still very nice and clean. Our rooms were on the 14th floor, where the view was completely blocked by the outside architecture of the building. And we had asked for king rooms and got 2 queen rooms. One of my parents key cards did not work as soon as we got on the elevator. When my father asked another front desk lady for a replacement, she accused him of not using it correctly. He told her that he knew how to use the key because one of the two was working fine. She seemed annoyed that she had to take 15 seconds to make a new key card.
reviews.title: Nice Rooms with Rude Staff
Splendid rooms but staff earned the 5
reviews.text: I again saw an elderly couple in the elevator who were having trouble with the key in the elevator. A woman was showing them how to use it, and again she seemed bothered and annoyed.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Staff at the lobby bar lounge was slow and unfriendly. Tables were left uncleaned for 45 min after people had left.
reviews.title: The Nines. The Best.

reviews.text: The valet people were nice; however, there was a cinco de mayo marathon the morning of the graduation and the valet were not informed. The streets were blocked and we had to walk 3 blocks to the garage with the attendent. They left us a notice in the room about this after 8AM the day of the race. We had no idea we needed to leave early and that streets were blocked. You would think the hotel would know to inform guests of this the night before.
reviews.title: Very Happy At The Nines

description: A downtown luxury hotel, The Nines, Portland hotel offers a boutique experience in the Pacific Northwest. Located next to Pioneer Square, we're the perfect starting point for your explorations.
